title: Inheritance Extending Classes - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Computer Science - Lesson 19

questions.question: What is inheritance in C++?
options: A process of deriving a new class from an existing class
questions.explanation: Inheritance is a process of deriving a new class from an existing (base) class. The new class is referred to as derived class and the existing class is called as base class.

questions.question: The new class in inheritance is called:
questions.explanation: In inheritance, the new class is referred to as derived class. The existing class is called as base class.

questions.question: The existing class in inheritance is called:
questions.explanation: In inheritance, the existing class is called as base class. The new class derived from it is called derived class.

questions.question: What is the most important advantage of inheritance?
questions.explanation: The most important advantage of inheritance is code reusability. Once a base class is written and debugged, it can be used in various situations without having to redefine it or rewrite it.

questions.question: A derived class with only one base class is called:
questions.explanation: Single inheritance: A derived class with only one base class is called as single inheritance.

questions.question: A derived class with several base classes is called:
questions.explanation: Multiple inheritance: A derived class with several base classes is called as multiple inheritance.

questions.question: The mechanism of deriving a class from another derived class is called:
questions.explanation: Multilevel inheritance: The mechanism of deriving a class from another derived class is called as multilevel inheritance.

questions.question: When one class may be inherited by more than one class, this process is known as:
questions.explanation: Hierarchical inheritance: One class may be inherited by more than one class. This process is known as hierarchical inheritance.

questions.question: A combination of two or more types of inheritance is called:
questions.explanation: Hybrid inheritance: It is a combination of two or more types of inheritance.

questions.question: How many types of inheritance are there?
questions.explanation: There are five types of inheritance: single inheritance, multiple inheritance, multilevel inheritance, hierarchical inheritance, and hybrid inheritance.

questions.question: Which symbol indicates that a derived class is derived from a base class?
questions.explanation: The colon indicates that the derived_class is derived (inherits some property) from base_class in the syntax: class derived_class : visibility_mode base_class

questions.question: If no visibility mode is specified in inheritance, the default mode is:
questions.explanation: If no visibility mode is specified, then by default the visibility mode is considered as private.

questions.question: How many visibility modes are there in inheritance?
questions.explanation: Visibility modes can be public, private or protected. There are three visibility modes in inheritance.

questions.question: Which data of base class cannot be inherited?
questions.explanation: The private data of base class cannot be inherited. However, the derived class has access privilege only to the non-private members of the base class.

questions.question: In public inheritance, public members of base class become:
questions.explanation: If inheritance is done in public mode, public members of the base class become the public members of derived class.

questions.question: In public inheritance, protected members of base class become:
questions.explanation: If inheritance is done in public mode, protected members of base class become the protected members of derived class.

questions.question: In private inheritance, public and protected members of base class become:
questions.explanation: If inheritance is done in a private mode, public and protected members of base class become the private members of derived class.

questions.question: In protected inheritance, public and protected members of base class become:
questions.explanation: If inheritance is done in a protected mode, public and protected members of base class become the protected members of derived class.

questions.question: What is an abstract class?
options: A class used to create many objects
A class that is not used to create objects
A class with only abstract functions
questions.explanation: An abstract class is one that is not used to create objects. An abstract class is designed only to act as a base class (to be inherited by other classes).

questions.question: The purpose of an abstract class is to:
options: Act as a base class to be inherited by other classes
questions.explanation: An abstract class is designed only to act as a base class (to be inherited by other classes). It is a design concept in program development and provides a base upon which other classes may be built.

questions.question: What problem does virtual base class solve?
options: Duplicate inheritance of members from common base class
questions.explanation: Virtual base classes are used for preventing multiple 'instances' of a given class appearing in an inheritance. It avoids duplication of inherited members due to multiple paths.

questions.question: When would you encounter ambiguity in inheritance?
options: When a class inherits from multiple base classes having a common base class
questions.explanation: When a child class inherits from multiple base classes that themselves have a common base class, the child would have duplicate sets of members inherited from the common base class, introducing ambiguity.

questions.question: How do you declare a virtual base class?
questions.explanation: Virtual base class is declared as 'class derived : virtual public base'. You can write either 'virtual public' or 'public virtual'.

questions.question: In the syntax for multiple inheritance, base classes are separated by:
questions.explanation: In multiple inheritance, the names of all the base classes follow colon (:) and are separated by comma. Syntax: class derived_classname : mode baseclass1, mode baseclass2

questions.question: Which inheritance allows you to combine features of multiple base classes?
questions.explanation: Multiple inheritance allows you to combine the features of multiple base classes.

questions.question: A member declared as protected is accessible by:
options: Member functions of the class and its derived classes
questions.explanation: A member declared as protected is accessible by the member functions of the class and its derived classes. It cannot be accessed by the member functions other than these classes.

questions.question: The difference between private and protected sections is that:
options: Protected can be inherited but private cannot
Private can be inherited but protected cannot
questions.explanation: The difference between private and protected section is that data present in protected section can be inherited. Otherwise both sections cannot be accessed by the object of the class.

questions.question: Public derivation does what to access specifiers?
options: Does not change the access specifiers for inherited members
questions.explanation: The public derivation does not change the access specifiers for inherited members in the derived class.

questions.question: What is the transitive nature of inheritance?
options: Inheritance can be passed on further
questions.explanation: One of the major reasons for inheritance is the transitive nature of inheritance, i.e., it can be passed on further.

questions.question: Inheritance ensures closeness with:
questions.explanation: One major reason for inheritance is the capability to express the inheritance relationship which ensures the closeness with the real world model.

questions.question: Which type of inheritance has a diamond-shaped structure?
options: Hybrid inheritance with virtual base class scenario
questions.explanation: The diamond problem occurs in hybrid inheritance where a child class inherits from multiple classes that share a common base class, creating a diamond-shaped inheritance structure.

questions.question: What does 'class marks : public student' indicate?
options: marks is derived from student using public inheritance
questions.explanation: In 'class marks : public student', marks is the derived class and student is the base class. The visibility mode public indicates that student is a public base class.

questions.question: In inheritance, derived class can access which members of base class directly?
questions.explanation: When we say that members of a class are inheritable, it means that the derived class can access them directly. However, the derived class has access privilege only to the non-private members of the base class.

questions.question: Although private members cannot be accessed directly by derived class, objects of derived class can access them through:
questions.explanation: Although the private members of the base class cannot be accessed directly, yet the objects of derived class are able to access them through the non-private inherited members.

questions.question: What is another name for the common base class in virtual inheritance?
questions.explanation: In virtual inheritance scenario, the common base class (like 'school') is sometimes referred to as indirect base class.

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for protected inheritance?
questions.explanation: The correct syntax for protected inheritance is 'class derived : protected base' where protected is the visibility mode.

questions.question: When members of a class are inheritable, it means:
options: The derived class can access them directly
questions.explanation: When we say that members of a class are inheritable, it means that the derived class can access them directly.

questions.question: Inheritance helps in:
questions.explanation: Reusing the existing code through inheritance saves time, money and efforts of writing the code again.

questions.question: What can you do without redefining the old class in inheritance?
options: Add new properties and redefine inherited member functions
questions.explanation: Without redefining the old class, you can add new properties to desired class and redefine an inherited class member function.

questions.question: Which statement about virtual base class is correct?
options: Only one copy of the virtual base class will be inherited
questions.explanation: When a common base class is made virtual, only one copy of the virtual base class will be inherited, avoiding duplication and ambiguity.

questions.question: The general form of defining a derived class includes:
options: Class name, visibility mode, and base class
questions.explanation: The general form of defining a derived class is: class derived_class : visibility_mode base_class { // members of derived class };

questions.question: In inheritance visibility table, what happens to private members of base class?
options: They become private in derived class
questions.explanation: According to the inheritance visibility table, private members of base class are 'not inherited' regardless of the inheritance mode.

questions.question: What is the key concept behind inheritance?
questions.explanation: Inheritance is one of the important concepts of object-oriented language, and the key advantage is code reusability - the idea that new class can use some of the features of old class (base class).

questions.question: Which inheritance type is specifically mentioned as allowing feature combination?
questions.explanation: Multiple inheritance allows you to combine the features of multiple base classes, as explicitly mentioned in the text.

questions.question: What does the colon (:) separate in inheritance syntax?
options: Derived class name from base class specification
questions.explanation: The colon (:) separates the derived class name from the base class specification. The base class(es) name(s) follow(s) the colon in inheritance syntax.
